thread.title: H.S. football: Offensive player of the year watch for Oct. 12,2015
thread.title_full: H.S. football: Offensive player of the year watch for Oct. 12,2015

title: H.S. football: Offensive player of the year watch for Oct. 12,2015
text:
H.S. football: Offensive player of the year watch for Oct. 12,2015 October 12, 2015 Last updated: Monday, October 12, 2015, 1:21 AM The Record 
Offensive Player of the Year watch 
Elijah Carlos, Ridgefield Park, sr. RB 
Rushed for 235 yards and two TDs in the Scarlets' victory over Pascack Hills. In six games, he has produced a North Jersey-best 1,095 rushing yards and 10 TDs in six games. 
Peter Guerriero, Lyndhurst, sr. QB 
Led the Golden Bears to an upset of Garfield by rushing for 314 yards and three TDs on 28 attempts. Became the first North Jersey player to crack 1,000 rushing yards this season (106 carries for 1,062 yards, 11 TDs in five games). 
Mike Pimpinella, Pascack Valley, sr. WR 
Caught seven passes for 215 yards and four TDs during the Indians' defeat of Bergenfield. In five games, has caught 23 passes for 584 yards and nine TDs. 
Derius Stone, St. Mary, sr. RB 
Carried 28 times for 325 yards and four TDs in the Gaels' win against Weehawken. Has 1,090 rushing yards and 17 TDs on 128 carries in five games. 
Keith Woetzel, Ramapo, sr. QB 
Completed 14 of 24 passes for 222 yards and rushed 13 times for 82 yards and two TDs to lead the Raiders over Wayne Hills. Has connected on 67 percent of his passes for 741 yards, six TDs and just one interception, in addition to rushing for 311 yards and seven TDs on 44 attempts in five games.
